sense.name: lengthy discussion, debate among parties
sense.commentary: DELIBERATION[+activity][+discussion][+debate][+lengthy] Note: implies a group of participants, not just one individual
sense.examples: The jury has been in deliberations for several days. After much deliberation, the committee finally reached a compromise. We must now make a decision on this without further deliberation.

sense.name: lengthy contemplation, thoughtful consideration
sense.commentary: DELIBERATION[+activity][+mental][+contemplation][+lengthy] Note: often implies the contemplation of a single individual, internal reflection
sense.examples: It was the deliberation of his act that was insulting. Bob gave surprisingly little deliberation to the consequences of his action. She was a woman of calmness and deliberation in all matters.

sense.name: a slow pace or rate, unhurried
sense.examples: He replaced the glass on the table with deliberation. Her deliberations in getting dressed made her miss the train.
